examples.text: yön (“direction”) + -el → (int.) yönelmek (“to face, to turn towards”)
diri (“alive, not dead”) + -l → (int.) dirilmek (“to come alive, to come back to life”)

etymology: From Ottoman Turkish ـال (-al, -el) or ـل (-l), a combination of Proto-Turkic *-(g)a (verb-forming suffix) and *-il (passive suffix).
